Reviews.Title: “A happy customer!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: I had not been back to Rome in 25 years and I figured it was high time...so when a friend from the world of antique rugs, Stefano Ionescu, offered me to set me up on a personalized tour to see some of the seldom visited highlights I embraced the opportunity. Relais 6 is a tasteful hotel near Stefano's home in a more residential area outside the center and was chosen for it proximity to his location. But it turned out to be a great place in its own right which I can highly recommend to any visitor. The room was spectacularly clean, the staff exceptionally friendly and the breakfast, included, was a broad and tasteful spread. It was a very nice place to back to after a long, hard day looking at masterpiece after masterpiece...a great place to kick one's feet up and relax...and I could relax as well because the hotel was good value for the money. I felt well taken care of and I can well recommend it to any visitor to Rome! This review is my way of saying thank you and best wishes to Relais 6!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Tulip34
Reviews.Content: Thankyou for a lovely stay . Only one teeny thing we weren't aware of before we arrived. We had specifically chosen this hotel as it had small apartments with a kitchenette . However on arrival the kitchenette was only available if staying for 7 days or it incurred a cost of €35 a day . This may have been in the small print but we were disappointed as we were unable to even make a cup of tea in our room . However in all other respects we were very happy and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kfraser4
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel. We loved the tranquility of the Hotel lounge and the very well priced drinks (4 Euro for a beer seems a good hotel price) we liked to hang out here after sightseeing or after dinner. The knowledgeable and friendly staff were great; the guy at reception said Hi to my 6 year old by name several times; nice touch and the Bar guy was also nice. We enjoyed going to neighbourhood restaurants which were recommended by staff. I especially liked the completely packed, totally unpretentious and extremely friendly S N Marino; they were great with my 16 month old daughter. This may have been a lucky mistake by us as the hotel recommended San Marino which is just around the corner. Pepe Verde (or similar) also good. We stayed in the apartment on the first floor, which was a little smaller than might be ideal for a party of 5, but generally happy with the rooms. Decent little gym on the top floor. Good breakfast. As discussed, it is quite far from the major sites, if you are ok with this or have a car (as we did) then its a really excellent alternative to characterless chains.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staying in this cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysonvacation12
Reviews.Content: I spent the last four days in this cozy hotel in Rome with my two kids. I had the apt on the fourth floor close to the gym of the hotel. The room was spacious, bright and very well kept. We slept wonderfully thanks to the fact that the hotel is on a very quiet street. The hotel is impeccably maintained and the personnel friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful staying. While the hotel is a little far from the most renewed monuments, it is very well served by public transportation. You can find busses that go everywhere in the city. The reception attendants are very knowledgeable and they help us not only to navigate easily in the city but they also reccomended wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good little family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomppa_n_Hanna
Reviews.Content: Good helpful and welcoming reception staff. Smallish rooms, but not tiny. Spotlessly clean throughout. In some hotels the reception is all glitzy and shiny but by the time you've made it up to your room it's a different story. Not here. It's all very smart throughout. The breakfast is good, lots of different bread, pastries, fruit, cereal, yogurts, juices and so on, but not much in the way of hot options. The coffee was amazing.The breakfast room / lounge / bar area are smart but in a relaxed way. Nothing like a boring chain hotel. It feel more like a home than the cookie-cutter standard global design of most hotels. Staff were smiley, polite and helpful. The hotel is 10 mins walk from Bologna metro station, which is a few stops from Termini, the central stop. The hotel is in a quite posh quiet area with lots of grand houses, but not much else. The nearest restaurants are a few blocks walk away. We went to Pepe Verde, which was pretty good but quite pricey, and La Chiacchiera, which was desperately rubbish. We only went there because it was Easter Sunday and nothing else was open. Avoid this restaurant at all costs. You're better off picking up McDonalds in Termini if nothing else is open. Seriously. The hotel has a small but adequate gym on the top floor. In our booking it said there was a mini-bar in the room which is free on the first night. Don't get too excited about this and expect that you'll be spending your first night drunk on miniature bottles of whiskey and full of peanuts. The free mini-bar actually comprises one can of Fanta, one can of Coke and two bottle of water. Don't let this put you off though. It's a great hotel and a welcome change from boring impersonal chain hotels. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY - VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Paolo B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a good price! We spent two nights in Relais 6 and we have to say that the place is really valuable. It is located in a nice and quiet area, not too far from city centre. Rooms (we had a supeiror) are new, big and clean. Good service and availability. All you need for a pleasant stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “A place to feel like home”
Reviews.Author: Isidore B
Reviews.Content: The staff at this establishment made our first time in Rome very pleasant and relaxed. We plan to come back and stay here again. We spent 4 nights here. We recommend it as excellent value for a couples place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short stay”
Reviews.Author: ww762801
Reviews.Content: We (three people from Austria) enjoyed our stay at Relais 6 very much. Very nice and clean room, excellent coffee and very diverse breakfast, good bus connections to Termini and Piazza Venezia. Will come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for families”
Reviews.Author: zkatona
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel with my family of 4. A comfotable and relaxing place just what you need after exhausting touring in the city. Great breakfast giving you energy for hours of walking. Staff was very helpful with everything, booking airport transfer, recommending restaurants, helping with maps and directions, etc. Location is pretty good, bus No 84 can take you quickly to Termini, and Piazza Venezia is not too far either. We would have preferred separated beds for the kids, but that was the only negative. We would return again, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel 10 minutes from Termini”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsCL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is situated in the northern parts of Rome with a ten minutes busride to Termini station (The central station of Rome). Our room was very clean and nicely decorated with a nice bathroom. A breakfast buffet was included in the price with different sorts of bread, some sausage and ham, some youghurts, scrambled eggs etc. The breakfast was good but not great. The service in the hotel was impeccable, you can trust the suggestions of restaurants that the service personal provides. The most impressive with this hotel however is that you get very much for very (in comparison with other hotels in Rome) little. We paid 60 euros per night for a four star hotel in Rome. I do not think that any other hotel can match this, if they can, please let us know :). The downside, if any, was that it is not situated in the center of Rome and requires a bus ride just to get to Termini which is not really located in the parts of Rome that you may want to visit. The public transport is not Romes best side, heavy traffic and crowded buses. We would recommend to take the metro if it is possible and stay away from the buses. It is also possible to walk from Termini to Fontana di Trevi and these areas but the stroll was not as short as we would have thought and more than one time we were a little bit frustrated about the lack of effective transportation. And, to take a taxi is not the solution either as the streets are very busy. So, by foot or metro. A day ticket for the metro system and bus system costs 4 euro and can be bought at the hotel. So, would we recommend this hotel? Absolutely! But, be aware that it is situated in a way that requires bus transportation and altough you get to Termini in 10 minutes you may need 30 minutes to get to the touristic center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: flyaquila
Reviews.Content: What should I say when everything was super and excellent? The room was big enough, clean and modern. There was a safe box as well. The breakfast was top. Best quality. Fruits were fresh. You got coffee in best quality. One cup or two cups or three cups... No problem. The next time when I will stay in Rome again I hope there is a room free for me

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - but quite far from centre”
Reviews.Author: clare2882
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent - it's clean, it's nicely decorated, the rooms are a good size, the ensuite bathroom was very nice, with a good shower. The staff at the front desk were very welcoming, and extremely helpful. They showed us where to get buses from to get to the different parts of town, and which ones to get; where was best to go to eat; where to avoid. The breakfast was ok - if you want scrambled eggs, get there early, or they'll all be either gone or cold. But there was a good selection of cold breakfast options - croissants, bread, cheeses, meats, lots of juices & fruit. The only issue that you really need to be aware of is how far out of town it is. It is at least a 20 minute bus ride in (you can't really walk it), so once you're out for the day, that is it - no popping back to the hotel to get changed before dinner/get a jumper/get rid of your bag. The hotel itself though, is excellent - as long as you don't mind the travelling into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service - would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Steveie B
Reviews.Content: We agree with all of the other good reviews here and can not really add anything extra. The customer service was excellent, very informative giving location of city centre areas and supermarket/restuarants that are within walking distance of the hotel. We kept the map that we were given, with personalised markings on it, for our whole trip. One point to note is that the 36 bus from Main Station does not run on Sundays; we were not told that ! Breakfast was a good selection and room service was good. We had a basic room but it was of a very high standard and great value as we booked well in advance. Good local transport makes this a good choice outsice the city centre with busses every 10 minutes, takling 20 mins from the centre, even with heavy traffic. Would willingly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: brancholive
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel better than my expectations. My previous stays at Rome wasn't quite enjoyable, but this hotel made our stay a wonderful experience. Everything was excellent. Thanks Relais!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel with very kind and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Apen
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in this hotel together with my girlfriend and we were both very happy with it. I stay in Rome on a regular basis for work and therefor have a good idea of what to expect. This hotel was far above average, the staff very helpful and kind. Further i liked the fact that it is not located in the touristic part of the city, but a bit north. I know that Rome does not have the best public transport in Europe (however they are working on a third metro line), but reaching the hotel and visiting all the famous places is very easy (either by bus or metro). I am not the best writer so let me state it in simple words: Do not doubt to choose this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thebaillies
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in the wonderful hotel as a party of 10. We had a variety of rooms - standard, superior and apartment, all of top quality. Very comfortable, spacious and clean. The staff are all extremely helpful, especially the bar tender. The breakfast is the best we have had on our many trips to Rome. Will use this hotel again and will definately recommend to other.

Reviews.Title: “t/bird in roma”
Reviews.Author: jaycee63
Reviews.Content: Having just got back from the Relais 6 and the city of Rome we would both like to thank all the staff for the help we were given on many occasions during our stay, nothing was too much trouble for the staff, whether helping us find a place to eat close to the hotel or bus tickets or calling a taxi. We had an early start one morning when we were going to Pompeii for the day and asked if we could have some food and coffee before we left at 6 am, this was no trouble and everything was ready for us when we went down at 5.50am. Transport links to the city were very easy to find and cheap, 1 euro for a 75 minute valid ticket and the Roma passport is excellent value at 30 euros all available at the front desk. This hotel is located in a lovely quiet area away from the noise of the city. If you are ever going to Rome this hotel ticks all the boxes and is excellent value. The rooms are clean and spacious with plenty of hot water and clean towels replaced daily. Very good breakfast with lots to choose from. Many thanks and hope to see you all again soon, Martin and June.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, lovely staff -”
Reviews.Author: Thegrumbleys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais 6 for 5 nights in Jan/Feb and we couldn't fault a thing. The hotel is beautiful and elegant, the staff are warm, friendly and welcoming. The lovely chap on the front desk gave us a map and marked out all the bus routes we would need to get all over the city. We found the location perfect - it's far enough from the City Centre to be quiet and peaceful, but close enough to be able to hop on a bus and be at all the sights within about 20 minutes. Apart from the first night when we got a taxi from Termini (word of warning - only go for licensed taxis!) we used buses all week.They could be very crowded, particularly early in the mornings, but we found this all part of the experience. Our room was fairly small but plenty big enough for 2 of us, the temperature was easily controlled and everything was spotlessly clean. The free minibar was a nice touch. Breakfast was lovely and fresh, with plenty of choice and the waiter had remembered our drinks order by the second morning. We spent an hour or so in the bar/lounge one night which has a lovely homely feel as though you are sitting in someone's living room. The barman was friendly and helpful - he recommended a cocktail which was amazing - just wish I could remember what it was! It was too cold while we were in Rome to use the terrace but we had a look and it would be great on a summers evening. I could go on and on about his hotel - it was such amazing value for such a lovely place. As someone said in a previous review, I really can't imagine going to Rome and staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Masha H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice (for Rome, don't expect the same value as in the U.S.) Quite and not too far away from the center (15 minutes on a bus). The rooms are rather big and with bath tab. Breakfast better than in an average hotel. Got an upgraded room for the first night. The main problem are the stairs in the entrance. If you are handicapped or with a little baby and a stroller, it can be a real problem. Other than that-recommended. Especially for people who need their quite to get a good night sleep. Not expensive at all for the value!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel mid-end Feb 2012. Was greeted very friendly on arrival. Service throughout the hotel was excellent. There was nothing too much for the staff, did not matter what. Breakfast was very good with a great choice for everytaste. Staff were super with information about tours to the various tourist attractions, places for eating out or just asking how your day had been on your arrival back at the hotel in the evening. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and there is a large sun terrace on the roof where one can enjoy a coffee after touring the city. All in all a wonderful Hotel - I´ll be back

Reviews.Title: “Great staff great hotel would definatley stay there again 10/10”
Reviews.Author: Linney36
Reviews.Content: Easy bus ride into all the sights all staff very well informed, wife's birthday and they made her feel very special, which gave me plenty if brownie points lol, they arranged a pick up from the air port at a great price straight to the door. Room was lovely very clean and first mini bar was free! Nice touch! Restaurants surrounding the hotels are a must very local dishes and a treat on the palate

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: smamu e
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights at roma in the Relais 6. The room was clean and cosy. The hotel has a house garden, a little gym (not for guys who want to train hard!!!) and a little museum (allied forces in italy while ww2) in the garden. Our air condition doesn't work and the flush a the toilette was damaged. The service was very good and the staff helped us a lot. When you drink something at the bar they serve little tasty snacks. Another highlight was the breakfast, it was very good for italien circumstances. Fresh fruits, scrambled eggs, nice coffee und sweet cakes. The bus station is only 200 meters away and 2 bus lines go in the city centre every 20 minutes. All in all a good hotel with good cost-benefit ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic week's holiday”
Reviews.Author: Guy O
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's break at this hotel and really enjoyed our time there. All the facilities that you would need are on hand including a small gym on the top floor. Everything was clean and the staff were very helpful. It was nice being just outside Rome so that we could eat and drink locally without overpaying. We also enjoyed the homely sitting room area by the reception area and there was an easily accessible computer to check on e-mails/internet. We would thoroughly recommend this small boutique hotel which was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mamba123
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days, staff was very helpful (advised us a local pizzeria with excellent food; and also how to get around the city). The rooms were hyper clean, and the area - quiet. You have to take the bus to get to the main sightseeing places, and on a Sunday there were not many of those. On the weekdays though they were relatively frequent, and you can get a direct connection to Vatican, Termini, and other places. The breakfast was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “business trip”
Reviews.Author: turista_affari
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for a business trip. I’ve found relais6 a very good hotel. Good location, good atmosphere, good service, comfortable and nice rooms, good breakfast. I would definitely recommend it! ...............................................................................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, disappointed with the service though”
Reviews.Author: Snickershey
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for one night as part of our honeymoon and were very much looking forward to our stay after reading all of the positive reviews. The hotel is very nice and clean and we had a nice big bed, but we were disappointed with the service, which I would describe as abrupt. When we asked about booking a taxi to the airport, the lady at the front desk offered to book us a private car for 55 euro or a taxi which was 50. We asked her to book the taxi and confirm that it would definitely be 50 euro and she said she would and would call us back. She called us back straight away, which was great, but she said she couldn't confirm an exact price and had booked it anyway. When we questioned this, she said that she couldn't cancel it, even though she had only that minute booked it, which we were somewhat annoyed about! Also, we booked a deal where there was a free minibar so we were looking forward to that, but it consisted of a can of Coke, a can of Fanta, and 2 small bottles of water, which I thought was a bit of a joke! So overall a nice hotel, but the service let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility but front desk is not very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: suzyq425
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean. Nice breakfast, including scrambled eggs and normal bread, yogurt, fruit type stuff. Totally awesome bartender. The wait staff for breakfast and the bartender was second to none. They tried very hard to understand what we wanted and delivered. Nice sitting areas. The problems with the front desk were: 1) The female clerk thought she knew everything and would get snippy. She did not understand everything we said in English, although she pretended that she did, and then when we would ask the same Q again, she would say something like, "Ma'am, I just explained that to you but since you did not understand I will do it again." When she never understood the Q in the first place. 2) When we asked for 2 extra hours for a checkout, the male clerk in the a.m. said absolutely not and would not consider it, when the night clerk told us it depends on what time the next guests are coming and he did not have access to that information.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian_dempster
Reviews.Content: We arrived late sunday night with the hotel arranging a taxi for us at airport, only to be told that the apartment room we booked last june was not available (we are aparty of 3, wife, daughter 18yrs and myself) . We were somewhat annoyed as we wanted the extra room for our daughter and liked the idea of the extra room. We were then offered a triple room or both a triple and small studio room at no extra charge plus a bottle of wine in the lounge. We chose the latter and had the benefit of 2 rooms. The hotel is immaculately clean, with truly beautiful common rooms, the lounge with a small bar is lovely and a nice place to meet new people and form friendships. Each night in the bar the hotel provides free food with is a lovely touch with sandwiches , crostini etc. The breakfast is very good with a wide selection ,if you want a full english this is not for you but the quality and choice more than compensates. The bedrooms are very clean and bathrooms have very good showers,beds comfy with feather pillows. Only problem was lack of coathangers but this was addressed at once without a problem. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the guy who runs the bar is brilliant (I think he is called Mem ). Without doubt if we return to Rome we would stay here, its about 15minutes to town on bus (stop less than 2 minutes away) costs 1 euro for a ticket each way.We eat locally at night and restauarant "Pepe Verde" just round the corner is very good food and prices. Mixed seafood grill 17euro with swordfish and prawns to die for.All in all an excellent base with good prices, great charm ,nice food and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Petite but well formed! Nice”
Reviews.Author: steveto710
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reviews in Tripadvisor. Great location to be near the centre but without the usual noise. Arrived at hotel in taxi from Termini (the first driver quoted 30euro for the short journey - as if I was born yesterday; told him where to go!!) The lady taxi charged 11euro included the bags charges. The hotel blended in nicely with the locale. The room allocated was cleaned and straight forward, just what we need for 4 days. Petite but well form. Free internet access was great because I can plan my day trips and search for bus routes around Rome's sites. Good range of continental breakfast on offer every morning. Worked out the best way to centre by bus or tram. Route 84 to Termini or Express 60 straight to Capital Hill! Very cheap with 1Euro BIT per 75mins, but would recommend 3day BTI or 7day card if stay longer or bus hopping around the sights. The only downside was no light refreshment in the evenings ( panini/ham,egg & chips type) You will soon sick the sight of pizzas after a day or two. It would be nice if hotel sells BIT tickets to get you going. Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chad M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! It is very clean, with a hotel-like yet family-like atmosphere. The hotel is new and decorated with alot of the owner's collections. The rooms are nice and clean...definitely a good value for the price! The breakfast and service is great. My husband and I enjoyed the excellent snacks at the bar/sitting room. We could almost just sit there and enjoy these instead of dinner. We must say we had a very personal touch. The staff was very helpful and they definitely went above and beyond! They sold us bus tickets, gave us tram instructions, and directions...they even went to the point to call tourist locations for us to find out what time they closed, and helped us check in online with our Airline, etc. Aside from this the owner provided us with a personal tour of his WWII museum that he has located in the back. We were also there during the snow and had some trouble with exchanging some currency, and the owner personally drove us to his bank! Now where do you find a place that does that! Overall we were very satisfied with our experience at Relais and would recommend to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerry M
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on foot of tripadvisor reviews. Was not disappointed. Staff excellent, rooms perfect. Breakfast more than adequate. Stayed five nights. Good choice of local restaurants nearby. We loved the Pepe Verde at 5 minutes walking, but were disappointed with restaurant Bruto at 10 minutes walking. Free internet a nice facility. Roads were extremely busy, and we chose to avoid buses. Metro was only 10 to 12 minutes walk to Bologna station, and connection to city centre was quick - we were at Coloseum 30 minutes after leaving hotel. We intend to retun again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: JFChile
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful property, clean and comfortable. A jewel on top of the crown for all the hotels we have stayed in this five country trip we are doing with our two sons, yet the less expensive. The staff was very friendly and informative. The breakfast was very good, Internet fast and free. The only thing that may be better is that this property is not in the center of the city, but no more than 15 minutes from the Coliseum. This is the hotel that I would definitely recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Two great stays....”
Reviews.Author: Chris939
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few night at the Relais 6 over the past month and were very pleased. While travelling with our infant son, this hotel provided a very warm and pleasant atmosphere for our little family. The breakfast/cappuccino was a wonderful start to the day and the staff was very helpful in selecting the best route and advice to Romes many attractions. The hotel is located on a major bus route about 10 minutes from the Colosseum and Forum o and we were never stuck waiting more than 5 minutes for the bus in either direction.The bar area, is a great spot to unwind and have a drink and hor d'ourves after a day of sightseeing. There hotel is in a very safe part of the city with several great restaurants and bars located minutes by foot. I must mention that during our first visit, a city wide strike in the public transit was going to strand us in the city on the day we intended on leaving and the hotel staff graciously amended our reservation on short notice and allowed us to leave the hotel a day early to get out of the city before the transit strike. Overall, we couldn't have been happier with our stays at the Relais 6. It was one of our favorite hotels while visiting Italy and I will confidently recommend this hotel to friends and family travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in that class I have encountered for years”
Reviews.Author: The2ndMouse
Reviews.Content: I actually picked it after reading the contributors views below, and today I entered and thanked all 3 first pages of contributions one by one! For its star category and class, this is a beautiful hotel. As mentioned by all, the staff is great. The rooms perfect, the internet free and the breakfast quite OK. Bologna metro station is 10 minutes away and the bus stop 2-3 minutes away ... so you could not easily carry luggage from the Metro Station. Below a friend mentioned that the hotel could have a vouple of chairs on the room and I may add that the wi-fi in my room was not as strong preventing faster speed working ... lost connection twice too. I wrote that to them in the customer opinion card (while congradulating them) but I am not such a great fan of elecromagnetic energy showers everywhere ... I was OK with working a bit at the lobby. I also had a business meeting that day and when I asked the staff offered me a nice room in the lobby level where I could meet the people without any charge. (I just bought them some coffee from the breakfast staff). To sum it up ... A wonderful hotel I will suggest to others and return to if ever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mridulgupta
Reviews.Content: The best hotel of our 10day euro trip. We booked it after looking at all the past reviews. Excellent well maintained property. Comfortable & spacious room. Superb breakfast. Location: Not in the heart of the city. but well connected with 2 min walk from bus stop (you can buy bus tickets at hotel reception). Service & Staff: very friendly and attentive. At under 50euro a night including breakfast & Wifi, its a great value for money too. Only thing that can be improved is to have directions, sign boards on the main road and at the hotel. After getting down at bus stop, we found it little difficult to locate the hotel. Hotel name display at the hotel is very small and easy to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joeri_van_Ormondt
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, quiet and nice hotel to stay for a couple of night. Breakfast is good, so is the room. Free internet! The bus connection to the city center is good. You can take a number of busses. All major tourist attraction are within a couple of minutes walk. Only downside was the lack of 2 chairs / a place to sit in our room, other than on the bed. This hotel is a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “A great stylish hotel with vintage surprises”
Reviews.Author: adelinacohe
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel, it has been renovated with great care, the building dates from the late 30s (quite a bit of marble about!) and the furniture is mostly from the 40s, with plenty of vintage collectables. It is very smart and welcoming at the same time, it almost feels like a home. Service is great, the staff are very attentive and helpful. It has no restaurant but the restaurants they suggested were very good and stumbled across other great ones near by. It is not in the centre and you need to take a bus to get there, but this has advantages as it is very quiet and the local restaurants are much more genuine. The room was very spacious and impecable, very stylish and with lovely wooden floors. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: Florin C
Reviews.Content: Rome is a beautiful city, perhaps the best in the world or at least the western world. My wife and I , we spent 3 beautiful days, even a little frosty, visiting a lot of places. It was a long walk but a beautiful one. Relais 6 is a very good hotel with excellent service and good staff. I recommend both Rome and Relais 6.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: JD Y
Reviews.Content: Very cheap given the high quality of this hotel. Staff were helpful and friendly, rooms were excellent (large and clean), and breakfast was very good. Bus stops were a short walk and the nearby restaurants were acceptable (staff recommendations were helpful). Definitely worth it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: valexoud
Reviews.Content: Supprisingly low prices for the excellent service offered. Much appreciated, highly recommended. Clean, quiet with very kind people.

Reviews.Title: “good stay in Relais 6”
Reviews.Author: hsiuhsiu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for relaxing, eating, travel counsulting though it is far away from city center. The room is comfortable ,breakfast is excellent and free Wifi is also a plus factor. I think it is well worth it's value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for budget trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: ceekaybee
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, rooms clean and spacious, breakfast great! Only gripe was that the hotel did not have anti allergy pillows which is not good when you suffer from a feather allergy, but cannot fault in any other way. Close to bus stop for trips into centre and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Stuart H
Reviews.Content: I'm going to give Relais 6 a 5 star rating, despite the minor issue we experienced on the first night. In all honesty, I had reservations about booking here as at the price we paid, it seemed, well, simply too good to be true. On arrival, the staff were very friendly, and thankfully spoke fluent English, as our knowledge of the Italian language is sparse, to say the least. Our one gripe with Relais 6 came on the first night. We had booked a double room for 3 days, but were mistakenly given a twin room on the first night. I obviously queried this, and was told that they had no double rooms that night, and that they would move us to a new one tomorrow. Not the best start to our romantic getaway, but it was only a minor hiccup. Apart from that, everything was perfect. The breakfast was lovely. Sadly, on our last day, we slept in and missed it. The rooms are decorated well, and have all the amenities required to make your stay comfortable. As others have mentioned, there are a couple of really nice restaurants only minutes from the hotel, all of which are reasonably priced. Contrary to popular rumour, Rome isn't as expensive as most say. For the price you pay, the location of the hotel is fantastic. There are two buses that stop 1 minute from the hotel - 36 and 84 - that take you directly into the centre of Rome. From there you can get a bus to any of the major tourist attractions. I never tried out the tram or rail systems, but have only heard good things about them. As for taxis, they're reasonably priced and fairly easy to find. Unfortunately, on the first night we arrived, there was a taxi strike, which resulted in us waiting 2 hours for a taxi to the hotel. Rome itself is amazing. Walking through town you'll be in awe of almost every building you come across. Relais 6 is certainly an excellent place to stay while you're there, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo I
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great service and a very helpful staff. The location is not the best, but very near to the bus routes. The bologna subway station is about 1500m from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay to get away from the commotion.”
Reviews.Author: A_Traveling_Duo
Reviews.Content: If you're OK with public transportation and/or walking, this is the hotel for you. Very helpful staff, close to a few different bus routes (two to the main train station and two to the city center), very clean rooms and excellent breakfast buffet. They also start your mini bar off with a free bottle of still and bubbly water along with a can of sprite and coke. The staff directed us to a nice restaurant the first day we got there and we stayed in the city center for the rest of our meals. Some of the buses were jam packed leaving the hotel and I can't imagine how bad that could be during the busier times of the year so location would be it's only negative tick mark...we had no issues finding our way to and from this hotel so there are no negatives from our point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: WestBridg1
Reviews.Content: Our 4 day stay here was perfect for us and excellent value for money at about 70 Euros per night. Our family room was big enough, comfortable and charming, with excellent views. The location was great -with a couple of really good neighbourhood restaurants nearby and very close to the bus routes to the centre of the city. We enjoyed the adventure of using the bus system - in fact, we probably got to see more of Rome this way than we would have done had we stayed more centrally (we bought the 4 euro day tickets from the hotel lobby and hopped on and off buses wherever took our fancy). The hotel staff were helpful and friendly and the building quirky and interesting. We stayed in August (I know, I'm slow at writing this up!) and there was a heatwave - it was lovely to return to our beautiful cool room at the end of the day.We've never drunk so much water in our lives - I advise to buy bottles in the cheap local shops, not central Rome, and also use the plentiful water fountains in the City. Breakfasts were fine, the only thing lacking was a hotel restaurant - but as the restaurants nearby were so good, this wasn't a major problem. We ate out in central Rome, too, and whilst the atmosphere of eating out centrally was great, the food at the local restaurants was just as good and very competitively priced. We booked a private car through the hotel to and from the airport, and would recommend this to others for the convenience and comfort, even though it's not the cheapest option (I think it was 50 Euros each way). A lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Iurii St.Petersburg”
Reviews.Author: Iurii P
Reviews.Content: Location is good for city trips and to relax after. Personal is friendly and helpful. The breakfast could be more diversified.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sheila3003
Reviews.Content: Relais 6 is a great little boutique hotel, situated in the Nomantana section of Rome. The hotel is surrounded by several Embassey, Kosoval, Australian, Malayian, Thailand and Uzbastian,and really nice Villa's don the area as well. The hotel it self is very clean, sparkling, with quite alot of charm to it. I booked 7 rooms from my group of 15, and each room was different. I stayed in the apartment 310, we truly loved it, the bedroom was a sunk in room with two twin beds. The living room/breakfast nok was very comfortable, and leads you out to a very large patio that over looks the area/villas. The bathroom was spaceous and the shower, which my room mate was so impressed with, had two tiled seats, nice. Again very clean in deed. Other rooms were equally nice, we had one room that was a loft, room 107junior, while I didn't stay in this room, It was quite unique, loved it. As I said all room were different. The breakfast were great, plentiful, I was quite surprised with all the selections, I have to say, don't look for anything different each day of your stay, But I was okay with it, because I didn't have everything the first time around anyway. The only down side to this hotel is no coffee/tea in room and no Iron/Ironing Board, you have to pay to have clothes pressed and you can only get coffee/tea at breakfast. So bring your own and ask for hot water. All of the staff were helpful. You can buy the ticket for the city bus and for the Hop on Hop off bus at the hotel. But don't let them tell you that you only have a certian time to get on, that is not true. The hop on hop off bus runs until the night and you can get on at any stop durning the hours of operation. We were told that we had to hurry in order to make it and some in our party took off running. We/I got to the bus, I found out that what we were told at the hotel was not true, so I did make them aware of this and told them not to mislead the toursit. I was assured it would not happen again. Overall, I/we LOVED Relais, and would stay their again, I do recommend this Hotel. It is close to the bus line, take the 36 to Termini from their you can get to anywhere. Go out of the hotel, turn left, go to end of block, turn left, go to Via Nomantana turn right, walk down the street past the gas station and on to the end of the block to catch the bus 36. There is a bus stop infront of the gas station stop, but the 36 does not stop there, you have to walk further down the street. I hope you enjoy your trip to Rome, and hope this post helps you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Calm”
Reviews.Author: Dave and Alicia P
Reviews.Content: Reglais 6 was a nice, comfortable place to stay during my family's vacation to Rome. The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The neighborhood was safe and easy to walk around at all hours of the day/night. Breakfast was large and included a wonderful cup of coffee made to order, croissants with a variety of toppings, cold cuts and cheese, scrambled eggs, granola and cereal and a variety of fruits. The location was nice if you wanted a calm place to stay with easy access into central Rome. The 90 bus runs frequently and it is easy to take to the Termini Station to get into central Rome. We ate dinner around the hotel at a variety of very good (and affordable restaurants) including La Chiacchura, Pepe Verde, and San Marino.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: GinHig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais 6 for my 30th birthday earlier this year and loved it. It was so nice to come back to such a peaceful setting at the end of a long day sightseeing. Our room was lovely and looked out over the courtyard at the back, and the bed was so comfy! The staff were all very helpful but particularly Giacomo - before our stay he answered all our questions via email and when we were there he gave us lots of restaurant recommendations and advice for getting around Rome. We will definitely be back if we visit Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gosia g
Reviews.Content: If you look for a basic 3 star hotel that's what it actually is. The staff are helpful & kind but the rooms are very, very basic and breakfast with stale bread every single day plus cold scrambled eggs as the only 'warm' breakfast component. No variety whatsoever. So for not demanding travellers who get 3 star rates just fine for those expecting good value for money somewhere close **** - a definite NO. Not even a single piece of carpet on the floor and tiny bathroom. Stayed for long enough to see improvement happen at least in quality of breakfast but peculiar as it may sound was happy to be served fresh bread at restaurants in town before dinner which normally is not a great luxury if you know what I mean....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell-Blackburn
Reviews.Content: Relais 6 was a great hotel a short bus ride from the historic center of Rome. It is set in a tranquil neighborhood within walking distance of several restraunts. Breakfast was a buffet style. There was always plenty to eat and the staff were attentive. The cleanliness of the hotel generally was excellent. I don't have any negative comments of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very GOOD!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: V G
Reviews.Content: I was very happy staying in Relais 6 one weak. Hotel staff was very kind and informed. Room are comfortable, nice top floor terrace, disine is cute & interesting, very-very good breakfast buffet, some free beverages in the minibar. Next time in Rome - Relais 6 obligotory))))))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: aehny
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Relais 6 during a brief holiday/vacation in Rome. I chose the hotel because I enjoy staying outside of the city center when I travel -- I appreciate experiencing different neighborhoods, and I don't mind making an extra effort to use public transportation. Relais 6 is exactly the sort of hotel I like: relatively small, elegant, with many "extras" that are otherwise unaffordable when you stay in a more central (i.e. more expensive) location. I will admit that sometimes it was frustrating waiting for buses, which were crowded more often then not. But I knew that would be the case when booking the hotel, and for me the pros outweighed that particular con. We received recommendations for two restaurants from two members of the very kind and informed hotel staff, each within a 10-minute walk of the hotel -- a plus after a long day of exploring the city on our feet. Both of them (San Marino and Pepe Verde) were excellent, and filled with locals. I wish there had been extra pillows availalbe in the room for guests (like me) who prefer more support while sleeping; also, the wifi was often slow; but those are minor complaints. The Relais 6 was everything I wanted: comfortable, cute, interesting, good breakfast buffet, even free beverages in the minibar. I will recommend this hotel to friends who like to stay off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: JenAth
Reviews.Content: We really liked everything about this hotel. Great staff, gorgeous rooms and common areas with a very tasteful vintage feel. Breakfast and garden were lovely, we also noticed the item collections in the "living room" and the small meeting room with the original old-theatre seats. Location should not put you off for being a little further from the "over-touristy" centre. It's well connected by public transport in a very nice area. What can I say, overall a great feel and quality, truly original and inviting... Many thanks to the lovely staff who helped us with all our questions, every time!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: willowinie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our First trip to Rome and enjoyed our stay here very much. The staff at reception were very helpful. Our room was great with a complementary mini bar and a nice terrace off our bedroom with a lovely view of the area. The hotel even has it's own Museum to allied forces to Rome and loads of history. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel but a bit far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: lifeacrossthepond
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was very clean, modern, and updated with good ammenities and a nice breakfast. Rooms were comfortable, plenty of hot water, automatic rolladen shades, free wi-fi, minibar, free breakfast, TV but no english channels. Very quiet location for a good nights sleep. Front desk recommended a nice pizzeria within walking distance, though there's not too much in the area. The main con in my opinion is the distance to the city center. You have to take the buses which are often crowded and unpredictable. They were a source of stress for us during our trip. Also, the eggs at breakfast were never replenished past 9:15 or so, even though breakfast ends at 10. They forgot to bring my hot tea as well. I know, minor things really, but I'm just being thorough. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as long as you don't mind the distance factor.

Reviews.Title: “charming Hotel as expected”
Reviews.Author: albrecht4k
Reviews.Content: the existing reviews allready stated that the place is not walking distance to the old town. You can take one of four buslines to get to the main station or old town. The metro station in a 10 min walk. Very charming house with kind staff. We had an appartnet with big terrasse looking on other old villas and palmtrees. Breakfast exccellent for itailan stándards. W-lan did not work in our room on the 3rd-floor. We had to go to the lobby or use the internet terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Mitr0Z
Reviews.Content: Very good value/money. Clean, tidy rooms with working air-con and automatized blinds. Bathroom fully equipped with utensils like shower gel, shampoo etc. Daily changed towels.Tv connected with speakers in bathroom and wardrobe. Good location - only 4 stops from the city center. Great breakfast with fresh juices, large selection of appetizers. There's terrace at the top floor. It's a pity there's no bar up there because apparently You can't hang out there with your own drinks. There's pleasant young fellow at the reception - he showed us the way to the supermarket and some fine pub.

Reviews.Title: “A real lodging gem in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: Archie Y
Reviews.Content: After doing some research on the internet on 4 star rated Rome hotels which could accomodate our family of 4, we discovered Relais 6 Hotel. Five weeks before our Rome vacation, we booked a 4 person room directly on the Hotel's website. We were most happy & satisfied with our stay at Relais 6. Even before arriving, we e-mailed the Relais 6 staff with questions and the staff was very prompt in replying back and they were succint in answering each of our questions in English. In fact, they even reserved a private taxi to pick us up at FCO airport to drive us directly to Relais 6 at a fair, fixed price. This really gave us peace of mind to start off our visit in Rome! We also requested a larger room on a higher floor for our stay. Upon check in, the staff was able to honor our request and we stayed on the top floor Junior Suite which had a bed larger than queen size and a queen sized sleeper sofa all in one large room. The very private bathroom was down a short hallway which was all part of the Jr suite. The bathroom had a hairdryer with shower only. The bathroom towels were plush with adequate toiletries. There was daily maid service as well. Our Jr suite had a mini refrigerator stocked with 4 nonalcoholic beverages included in our room rate. The entire Junior suite was indeed very clean, roomy, and ultra quite for sleeping. The bed & sleeper sofa bed were comfortable. The pillows may not be as supportive as some people would like. Everything in the room worked well except the free wireless internet signal was too weak on the top floor. We surfed the internet one floor below us while sitting on one of the public sofas. We never viewed any Italian television, but there was a 19 inch TV monitor in the room. The Jr. suite had direct access to the roof top deck, but we did not have time to enjoy that part of the suite. The exercise room was also on the top floor and the equipment was more than adequate to maintain fitness while on vacation. The included breakfast was fantastic! This buffet style breakfast was one of the best we have ever had. There was a wide selection of foods to meet the needs of many different style tastebuds. Hotel Relais 6 was located in the Northeastern part of Rome about 1 mile outside the boundary of the Ancient Wall. According to our taxi driver, this neighborhood was upper middle class. We felt very safe around the hotel at all times of the day & night. Using public transportation (Bus 60 Expressa), it took us about 30 minutes from the time leaving the hotel to arriving at the Colosseum bus stop and about 25 minutes to arrive at Piazza Venezia which was just before the Colosseum. All in all, Relais 6 was a gem of a place to stay, even the local telephone calls were included in the room rate! We found all the staff and accomodations were top notch and we would definitely consider Relais 6 whenever our next journey includes the Eternal City of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: gonzo8359
Reviews.Content: Good customer service, clean, shiny, nice breakfast. It is not that far from the city centre, there are buses that run to and from, only costs one euro each way. The guys on the desk are very helpful, and will give you a map and advice on how to see everything the easiest way. Would definately go back to the hotel. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Osie
Reviews.Content: Quality decor, with great service and extremely clean. The breakfast was also very copious. Alot of thought and expense has gone in to making the guests stay as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: E O
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Relais 6 for 2 nights recently. Very clean, comfortable hotel in a quiet location with friendly and helpful staff. Reception staff made excellent local restaurant recommendations. The hotel is a short bus ride from Stazione Termini. Good continental breakfast with some home baking. Relaxing lounge area with open fireplace. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Relais6”
Reviews.Author: Maria G
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this little hotel in a very nice and quiet neighborhood. The rooms are large for Roman standards and extremely clean. The staff is very helpful and breakfast is very nice. The hotel is 15 minutes from the city centre by public transportation, and Termini Station is just 10 minutes away. I highly recommend this hotel, you will get a bargain compared to the other places in Rome. If you do not mind taking the bus, this is the place to be when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Staff.”
Reviews.Author: jakkif
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean with a lovely roof top where you can catch some sun. The breakfast is good with quite a few hot and cold choice's. Mainly breads and cheese and meats. Also some fruit and yogurts. The only minus thing is that its a way out of the centre and a long long walk to the Metro, but the bus stop is about 300 metres. It is in a quite area. Taxi to the Airport was 55euros. Staff are very friendly and also healpful. Free interent and WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Wir haben uns sehr wohlgefühlt...”
Reviews.Author: Seagrave_de
Reviews.Content: Das Relais 6 liegt nördlich vom Termini in der Nähe der Via Nomentana. Viele Botschaften befinden sich in unmittelbarer Nähe, ein gehobenenes Wohngebiet. Der Empfang durch die Rezeption war sehr freundlich und aufmerksam. Auf Nachfrage wurde uns ein sehr gutes Restaurant in der Nähe empfohlen. Auch die beste Route zu gewünschten Sehenswürdigkeiten inkl. der besten Verkehrsmittel wurden erklärt. Wir hatten ein Doppelzimmer Superior gebucht. Das Zimmer war groß, mit einem kleinen Balkon zur Nebenstraße und mit gepflegten, alten Möbeln eingerichtet. Hervorheben möchte ich die Matrazen. Selten hatten wir so gute Matratzen in einem Hotel. Das Bad mit Duschwanne war sauber und funktional eingerichtet. Die Inhalt der Zimmerbar (2 Flaschen Wasser und 2 Dosen Softdrink) waren im Zimmerpreis enthalten. Das Frühstück war für italienische Verhältnisse sehr gut, Wurst, Käse, Rührei, verschiedenen Marmeladen, Müsli, Cornflakes, Kuchen, frisches Obst u.s.w. Und das wichtigste: ausreichend Kaffee in verschiedenen Variationen. Das Hotel hat auch unseren Transfer zum Flughafen organisiert. Mit 60 € nicht billig, aber da wir 4 Personen waren, war es immer noch billiger als mit dem Zug. Der einzige Kritikpunkt den ich finden konnte, war die schlechte WLAN-Verbindung im Zimmer. Diese wurde immer wieder unterbrochen und ich konnte keine Mails versenden. Wir haben uns sehr wohlgefühlt, ein tolles Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: avspook
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience here and would highly recommend this hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful, location is convenient to public transport, room is comfy and secure, breakfast is plentiful and above average for Italy. Wireless Internet is poor in general throughout Italy so we expected that but a wired connection is also available and is somewhat more reliable. It's not the kind of place you'd like to take rowdy children but our 7 yr old was welcomed and was fascinated with the fabulous decor. Absolutely top notch place and under 10 euros for a taxi to or from Termini if you've got too much luggage for the bus.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at Relais6”
Reviews.Author: Craig Z
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an attractive building on a relatively quiet residential street. It is a 5 minute walk to the bus stop and a 10 minute ride to the train station. The room was nicely sized and everything was spotlessly clean. The shower was powerful. Wireless internet service was sporadic in the room, but wired was fine. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with fresh cakes, croissants, cheeses, meats, scrambled eggs, yogurts, fruits, cereals, juices, milk and coffee. Fabio and the front desk staff were extremely polite and kind, and went out of their way to make us comfortable, help us find our way around town, help us book tours, etc. In short, we loved Relais6, and would not hesitate to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: infofinder
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel with very friendly, helpful staff. We chose this hotel because it was not in the middle of the touristy area of central Rome. it was much quieter, very safe and extremely clean. The rooms were good sized for Europe and even a small elevator for luggage handling.The staff gave great directions to reach any sightseeing areas. Bus and metro very affordable and very user-friendly. The staff recommended a terrific restaurant with tasty food, reasonably priced and fun staff.The hotel contacted us by email and provided directions to rea ch, even arranged a car to collect us from the airport (60 euros for 4 adults and luggage). Would definitely recommend and would use this hotel again. Thank you!!.

Reviews.Title: “good business facilities”
Reviews.Author: mariodebi
Reviews.Content: Went back to Rome mid october for work, and returned to Relais 6. Happy to report good meeting facilities, courteous staff, excellent wifi (for free!), and the great breakfast in the morning. Thanks to everybody, and keep up to good work!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Manuela T
Reviews.Content: beautifully decorated. large rooms with red burgundy walls, private large balcony, extremely friendly staff. nothing not to like... location: about 5 mins walk to bus stop that brings you to Piazza Venezia in about 15 mins. Taxi ride to piazza venezia about 12 euro at night

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: ziasun
Reviews.Content: With so may choices of Hotels in Rome and literally hours of searching for a Hotel in Rome we were lucky to stumble across Relais 6. After reading previous reviews I felt confident to book for our stay. Our experience with the staff was excellent from the beginning to the end. From arranging transportation, tours and early check in their was nothing the staff could not do and with a smile! Although not in the city center it was convenient to all locations, we enjoyed the nice quiet area that the hotel was located in. The hotel itself was one of the CLEANEST hotels I have ever stayed in. And the staff the Friendliest, the language barrier was no problem and they were so nice and helpful. The breakfast was fantastic with many different choices. If you choose this hotel you will have no regrets. It was a pleasure to stay at the Relais 6, I hope to visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “cozy”
Reviews.Author: Brigita-Urte
Reviews.Content: Very nice and cozy interior. Very helpful and polite reception employees (we stayed for 3 nights so probably saw all of them). There were lots of choices for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Relais 6 Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rowsphorn
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to stay at Relais 6 in Rome. This hotel is located about 15 mins via taxi from the centre of Rome however we saw this as an advantage. A lovely area which is safe to wander day & night with great eateries if you like to mix with the locals. One of these was a place called Numbs which had the best steak we have ever eaten! The hotel was beautifully decorated especially in the lounge area. We were able to purchase drinks here, which we have had difficulty at other hotels across Europe. The breakfast spread was great & the front reception service excellent. We would definitely stay here again if we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeNgui
Reviews.Content: Stayed with wife and her parents in a one bed room apartment for 2 nights in Oct. Lovely bar, breakfast room, common area and rooftop solarium. Room are clean and modern and good size. The sofa bed is surprisingly comfortable. Decor of the rooms is perhaps somewhat at odd with the common area though. Good breakfast with good range of pastry, cheese, Italian cold meat and scramble eggs. About 15 minutes away to city centre via bus and locating in a quiet residential area. Staffs are helpful. I don't think you can find similar quality of accommodation in Rome with this price point and the apartment room a very good option if you are planning for 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - I would go back”
Reviews.Author: AmyO_11TX
Reviews.Content: Rome can be a challenging city - it's big, the hotels are expensive, and it's hard to find a good one. Relais 6 was perfect and exactly what I needed after a long day of sightseeing (and after the long flight on the first night!) Here's why I loved it: - CLEAN! Fantastically spotless. - Great bathroom, great shower - exactly what I wanted - Felt totally "at home" - located in a quiet neighborhood. - Bus that goes straight into the city center (15 mins) is right around the corner - A pretty amazing free breakfast spread and coffee

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with baby!”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Relais 6 with our 5-month old baby for four nights in late September 2011. We were nervous about traveling to Rome with our little girl, as many of the hotel reviews in the center of Rome at this price point were quite poor. Thankful to say that our stay at the Relais was excellent! The staff were all friendly and polite and they all went out of their way to help us with our little one - from helping us carry the pram/stroller up the entrance stairs to sterilizing baby bottles at midnight! The staff were able to direct us to nice local restaurants and provide us with public transit options that brought us into the center of Rome. We stayed in room 205 and, when we arrived, the staff had set-up a baby-cot/pack-and-play in the room for us. The WiFi service was free and worked with our Apple laptop and iPhone4, although the connection did time-out once or twice. The room was very clean and there was just enough space for our luggage and barrage of baby essentials. The air conditioning unit functioned well. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was a great start to each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephenChi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on Sept 12. Since it is located outside of the main attractions in Rome, I was a little skeptical at first. What a surprise! Room is very clean. Area is up-scale and safe. Easy bus ride (10 to 15 minutes) to the city center. You can walk to the bus station in 2 minutes. Breakfast is very good! Hotel staff is courteous. There is also a couple of great restaurants close by - 5 minutes walk. At the end of my trip - after touring Tuscany, Venice and a 1-week cruise, I went back to stay in this hotel 3 more nights before I flew home. Overall, it is highly recommended. In the past I had always looked for hotels within walking distance from the train stations. I've learned this time that it is worth looking outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Rome for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: consum3r
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in august, so the room prices were cheaper than within season. There is not much more to add compared to the other comments. The hotel is very new, the rooms are clean and tasteful furnished. The receptionist gave as some very useful advices at the beginning, for example to buy the combi-ticket for colloseum at the forum romanum, which saved as a lot of time, because we could skip the long queue at the colloseum. The only “negative” thing is that this hotel is situated a bit outside the city center, so you always have to take the bus. In august, the buses do not go as often as in the other months, so waiting times will be longer. Altogether, it was a very pleasant stay in Rome and we would absolutely recommend choosing relais 6.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: littlerhodyJo
Reviews.Content: Relais 6 is an affordable hotel with a courteous and helpful staff. The suites are roomy, comfortable and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful experience at the Relais 6”
Reviews.Author: undici
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago just after opening and were not disappointed on this return visit. As other reviewers have stated it is a bit out from the city center which I consider a real advantage after long days of navigating the crowded streets and museums downtown. Access is quite simple, the bus stop is around the corner and you can catch a ride to Termini or Piazza Venezia, both good locations for connections or walking. The rooms are well appointed and decorated very tastefully demonstrating a esthetic not normally seen in hotels of this price category. The included breakfast was the best we had on our trip. Next time I will book a superior double to get a bit more room even though the standard more than met our requirements. The owner and staff make you feel as if your really are their "guests". We think it is a steal. Suzanne

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great stay”
Reviews.Author: Hardy H
Reviews.Content: The hotel gave us a beautiful 2-room apartment with a separeted little dressing room and bath. Not only our rooms, the complete hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and always very patient and helpful. The breakfast buffet which is included is absolutely ok, only the tables in the breakfast room are a little bit small, but ok. The bus station is only two minutes away. We are sure, we will come back on our next Rome visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Scott A
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to get a reasonably-priced, quiet hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are a reasonable size, clean, and well-appointed. We were very pleasantly surprised that one of our two rooms had exclusive access to a very large rooftop terrace: it could easily accommodate 20 people. Because the hotel is in such a quiet area, the terrace was a perfect place to have a glass of wine at the end of each day. Based on other reviews, I was concerned about access to public transport. We live in a rural area and the only time we use public transportation is when we travel. I have no idea what the reviewers who complain about access to public transport from this hotel are talking about. Those reviewers who claim the bus stop is 10-20 minutes away must literally have crawled there: the bus stop is a couple of minutes away, and is very easy to find. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus, which takes you directly to Termini. On those occasions when we had wandered very far from the hotel, indulged in dinner and wine, and didn't want to ride a bus, a taxi ride was quick, convenient, and reasonably-priced.

Reviews.Title: “See Rome and Die”
Reviews.Author: grannie5_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent time although the weather was hot and it was late September when we were there would not recommend going in July or August and it was packed.Take comfy shoes and lots of deoderant as the bus journeys are quite an experience and even when its full more people pile on, it gets very friendly ! Take plenty of money as lots of tours only take cash although it did say they would take cards .......we had to go to the bank twice for cash and we only went for 4 days.We did all the usual sights plus the open top bus which we thought was a bit naff , some of the the info coming through the headphones didnt match the sights you were seeing. I found our Hotel on tripadvisor and it was spot on, Great place to stay and just far enough out of the centre to be able to have nice relexing evenings after hectic days in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: grays693
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in good area.Easy access into Rome by bus.Good buffet breakfast.Would recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pansypotter1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Adviser reveiws and were very pleased with our choice. Service was excellent and staff very helpful and attentive. Although room was a bit small this was more than made up with the charming character of the room - it had traditional pieces of furniture, a massive bed and had pretty view on to the street. Hotel was immaculate and very clean. Breakfast was good and plenty to choose from. As others have said, the hotel is away from the main attractions but there are plenty of regular buses - the 36 & 84 go to the Termini. If interested, if you prefer to get a bus from the Termini to the hotel, the number 36 (this bus can be found in area N) and get of at the Nomentana/Grozia stop which leaves you with only a 250m walk to the hotel. There is also a number 90 which also goes up the Via Nomentana but can't remember the name of the stop as we never took this one. The buses are frequent though. There are some good restaurents nearby and the one we liked best was the Pepe Verde but very busy - which I think is a good sign! You won't go wrong with this hotel and recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandraDeePerth
Reviews.Content: Even though Relais 6 is not within the CBD, all that Rome offers is a short and convenient bus ride away. The hotel is lovely and clean and the staff is most helpful. The neighborhood is peaceful and a couple of pleasant parks are nearby. An excellent breakfast is on offer and the complimentary drink vouchers were most appreciated. As 40 something first time Aussie travelers to Rome, we found this hotel suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Travelers in Italy”
Reviews.Author: asp53
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel find in such a big city. The staff were all very helpful, rooms were large (by European standards), well appointed and very clean. The breakfast was a nice selection of fuits, meats, cereals, and even fresly made eggs!! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: Sabine G
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at Relais 6 and enjoyed my visit very much. This hotel is a beautiful place with a very tasteful interior design. The room was very comfortable, clean and air-conditioned. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I also savoured the breakfast's variety very much. My stay was too short to discover all of Rome, so I would love to come back one day. When I do so, I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to leave!”
Reviews.Author: mrtomo3
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel was excellent with a tasteful decor throughout. On arrival the receptionist checked us in and gave us a briefing about the hotel facilities and also offered to give information regarding tours and the city. The lounge area was lovely, despite wine being rather costly the service was excellent along with some tasty nibbles. The room was a decent size, just a shame all the tv channels were in Italian however this was unavoidable due to the digital switch-over. On the whole, great hotel and can't fault it at all. A well deserved 5 out of 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leanne R
Reviews.Content: This is the best place I have stayed in many trips to Rome. The hotel was easy to access via frequent bus routes. Lovely atmosphere, nice staff and good facilities for relaxing (nice terrace), and great breakfast with lots of fresh fruit. I travelled with my parents and we had 3 comfortably in a room. The only downside was that the third bed (mine) was a folding single bed with a thin mattress that would have been perfect for a child, but was a bit uncomfortable for a 4 night stay as an adult. The hotel also could not provide an iron or ironing board anywhere for use of guests as it was a 'safety issue'. Still, it was a great 5 days in Rome & the Realis6

Reviews.Title: “A classy place in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: I picked this place for a one-night stop because I'd been working hard for a week, and wanted a quiet, comfortable 24hrs in Rome before catching my plane home. It is siituated in an upmarket residential area - which means the streets are safe and quiet, but there few shops or restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The hotel is stylish, clean and characterful. The breakfast buffet was very good - plentiful and fresh, from cereals and breads to fruit, meat and cheeses. There are attractive rooms lined with bookshelves and tasteful antiques, with sofas for lounging. On the roof there is a sun terrace and (a rather too public?) mini-gym area, with proper treadmill, stretching area and resistance machine. My room was on the smaller side, but everything was immaculately clean. The bed was very comfortable and I had the best night's sleep for ages. I had a full-size bath, and the aircon was very welcome. I appreciated the free wifi and four free (soft) drinks that were included in my special room rate. The only small drawback was that, travelling to and from the hotel by public transport with suitcases was slightly tiresome (perhaps the 40 degree heat made it seem tougher! - and on Sundays there seemed not to be so many buses). There are several routes from Termini along the nearby major road, Via Nomentana, but the stops are quite a long walk away in either direction. It was very helpful that the hotel sold one-day travel cards, at cost. Once on a bus, I found it easy to access all parts of the centre from Termini. Overall, I would recommend this hotel warmly, and return when I next visit the Eternal City. on a Sunday

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucea27
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms, one of which was a quad/apartment and the other was a triple. The quad had a queen beed and a pull out with two twin beds. The rooms were quite spacious, clean and modern. Beds were suprisingly confortable! We got free usage of the mini bar the first night! The bathroom was spacious and clean. The only negative we found was the lack of english channels on the tv. There was a message posted in the elevator stating they had limited control over it. The concierge desk was quite helpful with suggestions on where to eat and how to get aroun town, including our day trip to Venice. Jaqamo and Fabio at the front desk were so patient and sweet and handsome might I add :). Breakfast is continental but sufficient. Hotel is located in a suburban area of Rome but the bus stop is within 5-10 mins walking distance. Relais is our choice hotel for our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 875DN
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel, just far enough from the centre of Rome to provide some quiet and allow a pause for reflection from the hectic pace of the city and just near enough that everything is easily accessible. (We used Bologna tube station a 10-15 minute walk away on line B, which takes you straight into the city, Colosseum, etc., but buses come closer if you don't want a pleasant stroll in the evening warmth.) The hotel itself was a great find amongst the vast swathe of Rome hotels, well presented, with a charcater of its own and friendly and helpful staff. We stayed for 3 nights but the hotel would serve equally well for a longer trip in our view.

Reviews.Title: “Same as everybody else, had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: BURGEL
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 09/08 to 13/08 in an aprtment that had 2 rooms which was perfect for our family of four. As previously noted the hotel staff are extremely frindly and helpful and this provides excellent value for money.It was a 2 minute walk to a bus stop and then only 10 minutes to Termini station from there. In addition the hotel arranged a taxi for me from the airport to the hotel for only EUR60 which was waiting for us as soon as we came out of arrivals.As there were 4 of us this was good value and a lot easier than public transport with all of our luggage. I can't speak highly enoigh of this hotel and would definately use it again if I ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: MJCotterill
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to anyone when visiting Rome and the nearby attractions. The buses and the local public transport was easily accesible and very useful when travelling in and out of Central Rome every day. Also in the WW2 museum which was particually interesting to our son who found this really interesting as they opened specially for us. The breakfast provided was really tasty and had something for everyone to eat from cereal to croissants!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice !”
Reviews.Author: Budel
Reviews.Content: For a 4-star Hotel in Rome, the price is incredible low. Nice atmosphere, clean rooms and good breakfast. The location is perfect; taking the public bus, within 15 minutes you're in the centre of Rome. Parking your car in front of the hotel for just 7 Euro/day. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Choose this hotel and you won't regret !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for a great venue”
Reviews.Author: Acadianorth
Reviews.Content: Although it is 15 minutes by bus from ancient Rome, it was worth it for the incredible value. The room was great and the included buffet breakfast was too. There are several bus lines and the buses come regularly. A taxi costs about €15 to get to the main station, if needed. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: PSJ64
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, we had a great stay. The room was a little small and quirky but the staff helpful and polite, bus route in to the city is close. . Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - we will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: WelshmamOF2
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. We stayed in room 410 (I think?!), it was the only room on the top floor and we had our own private roof terrace - amazing! There was also a gorgeous covered terraced area and small gym on our floor too which was a real bonus. Excellent service, super clean rooms and dining room, lovely outdoor eating area and fab breakfast. Bit of a walk to the centre of Rome and we didn't quite get the hang of the public transport system. Taxi will cost you about 10 euros but there are local buses and I believe a nearby metro. Really enjoyed our stay here and it was great at the end of the day to return to a quieter area after a busy day's sightseeing. Can't wait to go back!
