Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable place outside city center”
Reviews.Author: FlyyyCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais 6 because the places in the city center were just too expensive. It is in a quiet area. Getting there by taxi was a bit of a mission, but that is probably just because taking a taxi in rome is always a mission. Altough we arrived early (10AM) we were already given a room. Room was nice, small table and big enough bathroom downstaris, then upstais a double bed. Internet was free. Breakfast excellent. And the area very quiet. And the terrace on top of the roof very much appreciated after a day of sight-seeting in rome. Also there is a little gym with some weights and threadmill. Location is, well... there are good bus connections to the city center. the subway does not (yet) go to the area where the hotel is. Outside the hotel there is very little happening. Did not see any restaurant nearby. Overall it was a good choice to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, helpful. Simply perfect.”
Reviews.Author: rq11530
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in the middle of our 2 week holiday. For one we didn't realise it was a 4 star hotel, my bad, and the beautiful, welcoming reception area was a relief after a long journey. The staff were excellent and gave us everything we needed, right down to which buses round the corner went to the station and other sites like the coleseum and trastevere. Also the hotel supplied us with lovely soaps and shower gels etc. The room was a decent size, we had the smallest double room as we were travelling on a budget, an excellent value for money. The only complaint my boyfriend had were that the room was yellow and the main lights made it more yellow, but i don't think this would make us not stay there again! Breakfast was decent if not slightly early for us, 7-10 meant we were getting up earlier than we would have liked. Overall our stay was lovely and if we return to Rome we would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Roma for our quick vacations”
Reviews.Author: Giorgio_753BC
Reviews.Content: I've been in other places and other hotels in Rome, but this place is really unique. It is not overcrowded (like many other places), plenty of free room and space (including the lovely outdoor place for breakfast), the rooms are spacious, clean, efficient, modern (and everything works to perfection, AC, TV, safe, etc.), the free breakfast is excellent and the choice is huge, and the staff is extremely friendly and useful. Next time in Roma I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but some big problems”
Reviews.Author: Pickles
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews about the lovely rooms, common spaces and neighborhood of this hotel. Some of the staff, notable Giaccomo, were outstandingly helpful. That being said, we found two problems: the internet is unusable. We could not even send and receive emails without logging on at least five times. Because my spouse was traveling on business, this problem was untenable made him unable to fulfill his work responsibilities. In addition, we were traveling with another couple, and when they arrived (several hours before we did) they were told that their room had a problem and they needed to stay in another hotel for one night and back to Relais6 to complete their three-night stay. Although Relais6 paid for a taxi either way, packing up and moving in the middle of the day was certainly a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay for vacation!”
Reviews.Author: wingfold2
Reviews.Content: we had a great time in Rome and don't believe we could have picked a hotel we would have liked better than the Relais6. We especially appreciate the helpfulness of the staff (especially young man who worked in evening who helped us make reservations, made all sorts of useful recommendations, etc.). My only complaint is that the Internet was almost unusable - actually, it -was- unusable from our room (wifi signal was so weak, none of the 4 devices we had could connect) but even from the lobby the bandwidth allocated was so limited we could barely check email. Would highly recommend a new/improved Internet access setup (both for connection to outside world - and improved Wifi access within property). Other than that, though, we could not have hoped for a nicer place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty delighted”
Reviews.Author: ElisIordache
Reviews.Content: Booked it just for one night, just on our pass though Rome, we needed a nice and warm hotel, close to any bus station going to Termini in order to see the city sights. The service was really nice, the breakfast healthy. Both receptionist gave their interest to show us how to reach the best spots in the city. Signed their guest list with pleasure and for sure if i will hit the Rome again, will get a room. My double standard was very intimate, not too large but enough to make us feel comfortable. The downstairs bar and rooms are designed with an unique taste.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PERFECT PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: tankgirl243
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of hotels and have gotten quite picky, usually when staying at a hotel there is a "but...it did't/ or did have (fill in blank)" . BUT with this hotel we had no "buts". Rooms were clean, staff at the front dest were extremely helpful and very fluent in english. Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights and found it very easy to get around Rome, you can catch a bus to the termini about 2 min's away. The area where the hotel is located is very nice, there are some restaurants and shopping nearby, and it's not filled with all the usually tourist crap that is at every store near the termini. The electric shutters were great for jetlag - because you can make the room completely black if you want. The water pressure in the shower is great and you can fill the tub pretty quickly. We had one of the apartment rooms and there was a kitchen available to use if you were staying for a week, or you can pay extra to use it otherwise. (but really you're in italy- i think everyone wants to go to restaurants instead). Our room also had a safe in it. beside the "bedroom" was another room with a couch in it (it is a pullout couch- for people travelling with more then two people) From here we did all the regular attractions and used the Rome pass to get around, so its easy to use the transit system. WIFI- is strong and you just need to get a free code from the front desk. Breakfast- eggs, best salami ever,cheese , toast, jams etc. They also sell bus passes at the front desk. Check out the rooftop patio, it's quite nice up there at night with some wine. If I went back to Rome I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. we were just there may 22 until may 26th

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and we'll go back,would recommend .”
Reviews.Author: christine-myers1960
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome,the Hotel and staff were fantastic nothing was too much trouble, every one we came into contact with were lovely,our room was great, the whole of the Hotel was great,we just loved every thing,the area not too far from the centre, we used to get the 90 bus to the Termini which was four stops away, but you could stay local in the evening if you have a busy day sightseeing, with good restaurants, wine bars, bars and cafes just a stroll away in a good residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: marzas
Reviews.Content: I enjoy every moment of our saty at this hotel. Wondefurl service, helpful and friendly staff, celan and comfortable room. We even have got a room with our own roof teraace, please see the picture of the view attached...

Reviews.Title: “New Building, Clean, Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: adelicious
Reviews.Content: The room was new, spacious, super clean, good fregrance, pink romantic n elegant, bathroom was not too big but clean, comfortable, fresh, and complete amenities. The room have wide balcony terrace with metal chair and table, astray for smoking, and beautiful view. The food for bfast was standard but delicious, the staff was nice and helpfull. The location of this hotel is strategic and good value, the best choice in center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good, short stay”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsSprouter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly based on proximity to my meeting place but also on positive reviews. The front desk man was EXTREMELY helpful, with lots of tips on getting into the center. Found out they gave me a "superior" room upon arrival which I suspect was due to an overbooking. It was on the "3rd" floor and quite spacious, with a small balcony with table. Wish I could've stayed longer than 2 nights to enjoy this. Breakfast was just what I needed, not more not less. Had thought the room was a bit dark then found out on the last day that the window shutters go up but switch was not obvious... duh! Mini-bar is free the first round, with a Sprite, Coke, and 2 waters. Shower knob was stuck on HOT the 1st day, but was fixed after I told them about this. The only negative factor which would affect my decision to stay here again is the bad wifi which kept dropping and at times not accessible at all, and wonder if this was related to my being on a higher floor. The hotel is within walking distance to some grocery stores (I liked the Carrefour) convenient for stocking up on snacks. The nearby Pizzaria San Marino was recommended by the front desk and was very reasonable and yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to this absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: Aidanp
Reviews.Content: How does one write a review for what was in our opinion the "perfect" place from which to soak in the magic of Roma. Breakfast A1 Rooms A1 Staff & Service A1 Ambience A1 Value A1 All of the above, and more, was but a 15 minute/ €1 bus ride into Roma Termini. PS. We loved the no nonsense chauffeured service to and from the airport....nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem - I'm not sure I want other people to know about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gnreid
Reviews.Content: What a find. A mid budget hotel but with a luxury, five star feel. A 12 Euro taxi ride from the Termini train station brought us to a very pleasant, suburb of Rome in amongst the embassies. Reception staff were efficient and helpful and directed us to our sixth floor room via a lift. When the lift door opened, we found we were the only room on the floor and the lift took us straight to our room. It felt like a penthouse! Once inside the room, to the left was the spacious, clean and powerful shower and bathroom. There was then a long corridor/hall to the main bedroom, with plenty of space and very comfortable beds. The decor was classy, as it was throughout the hotel. Step outside the room and there was a large sun area. Take a walk up a beautiful metal spiral staircase and there was yet another sheltered and private sun area with loungers/table. On our floor there was also a new, fully equipped gym and another sun area. No surprise that we spent the whole afternoon lazing about on, what felt like, our penthouse floor. Breakfast was in a beautifully decorated back room and was substantial, quality and with added extras (for Italy) like scrambled egg. Service was excellent with wonderful coffees served to your table. A short walk away are shops and supermarkets. In the opposite direction is a bus stop with regular buses (every 10 minutes) into Rome and all the sights. Tickets were sold at Reception. It was a fantastic hotel to return to after a busy day sightseeing. An oasis of calm, tranquility and comfort with a log fire, large leather sofas, outside seating areas and even a museum. Everything about the hotel felt new, quality and as if a lot of money had been spent on it. I would recommend this to anyone, but I am not sure whether I want others to know about it. I want it to remain my own hidden gem in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: smew142
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Relais 6 for one night and there was nothing to complain about. The hotel is beautiful, nicely decorated, has a bar, a little garden and an elevator. If you want to, you can have free wireless access to the Internet. The staff is very friendly, polite and obliging. The room was clean and bright. It is situated in a quiet area, but is still quite central (with a bus stop in the next street, 10min away from Termini). The breakfast was fine too, with fruits, yoghurts, ham, cheese, jams, eggs, various types of breads, cakes, juices and coffees. We would definitely recommend the hotel and, if we ever come back to Rome, we will book it again.

Reviews.Title: “A few minor negatives but overall a very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Supadappa
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights at this hotel which we booked because of all the positive feedback on this site. Overall we weren't disappointed. The staff were courteous, helpful and all spoke good English. They were forthcoming with answers to whatever questions we had. Our room (104) was quite small but nicely furnished. It was on the 1st floor but the window was not very high off the ground so we weren't happy to leave it open at night without lowering the shutter. The a/c did not work properly and blew out hot air instead of cold. I called a staff member who could not work out what the problem was either. But this wasn't a big problem as the weather was pleasant but not baking hot so it was ok to just have the window open. The walls, floor and ceiling were quite thin. We could hearing people banging around in other rooms and talking in the bar below. One night I was woken by the noise from somebody's tv. I also found the pillow to be too soft but maybe that's just me as my girlfriend said hers was fine. The wi fi signal was 'ok'. The buffet breakfast was very good and varied - coffee made to order, cereal, breads, meat, cheese, yogurt etc. Although there was never much scrambled eggs left when we came down between 9 and 9.30 (breakfast served from 7 - 10) and they didn't refill it. Downstairs next to the breakfast hall was a bar area with sofas and books and newspapers. Free finger food was provided - nuts, crisps etc (we particularly liked the crispy chicken sandwiches!) Out the back were seating areas and a small museum of WWII memorabilia collected by the hotel owner. On the top floor was a small gym with running machine, cross trainer and weight machine and bench. This must be quite new as I didn't notice it mentioned in previous reviews. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is located a little bit out of the center. This wasn't a big problem as there were a number of restaurants in the area and the bus stop was just around the corner, from where it was a short journey to the central station and/or the historic center. But with hindsight I would probably have liked to stay a bit more centrally, making it easier to take evening strolls without having to think about taking the bus home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to bus and Metro. Perfect for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: mickew
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner spent nine nights at Relais6 when we visited Rome at the end of March 2011. The hotel we highly recommend when to explore Rome. The hotel is very familiar with very nice rooms, we had a standard room. The staff is really nice and the service is fantastic. Free wireless WIFI included during your stay. Breakfast is great, sure it's not in class with the hotels in Sweden, but had absolutely nothing to complain about. Connections to the hotel is great. There are bus stops 100 meters from the hotel and a 10 minute walk to get to the Metro station Bologna. Next time we visit Rome, it will be a welcome return to Relais6. Many thanks Relais6 for a great stay at the hotel. We will be back soon! Sincerely, Mikael Westerberg / Cecilia Johansson Sweden

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel that made us feel at home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bobbycarp
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and found the hotel a relaxing and friendly place, perfect to end a busy day sightseeling, with a few glasses of wine in the bar. The location was slightly out of the centre, but the bus service was excellent for 1 euro a trip and a bus every few minutes. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and being out of the centre were quiet too! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would certainly return there myself

Reviews.Title: “Stilish hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mariodebi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in residential area far enough from the mad roman traffic, and close enough to reach the centre with a 15 minutes bus ride from via Nomentana. It is quite stylish, but not pretentious, with great attention paid to details, and you get a homy feeling as soon as you step in. Little touches like the open fire place in the lounge, hand painted tiles in the bathroom, and the breakfast buffet with home made cakes baked by one of the owners put this hotel in a different category, but what really made it for me was the perfect darkness of the room (good electric shutters), and quality mattress.. I enjoyed my stay at Relais 6, went there for work, but I would not hesitate to go back with my family to visit this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura999_11
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, and the staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Before going we were slightly concerned by the location, however there was nothing to worry about! There were several buses taking you to the city centre and the trip was only 5 minutes. We would have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and spotless hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: ghost-toe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais 6 for the first night of our tour of Italy in Feb 2011. Prior to beginning our trip, I had second thoughts about staying here as I realized that there wasn't a lot of information available. In fact, the limo driver (a Roman native) who drove us from the airport to the hotel said he'd never heard of Relais 6 before, or even been to the neighborhood. Fortunately, Relais 6 is an excellent hotel and we had a great stay. Its rather low profile meant that there weren't many other guests, allowing us to fully appreciate its tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean interiors. There were plenty of antiques and old knick-knacks, even a small WWII museum. Room: We booked a standard triple room which felt a little cramped (though the size was probably par for Rome) . Bed and HVAC were good. TV was small and had mostly local channels. Service: Front desk staff were polite and efficient though a bit aloof. Other staff were very friendly and accommodating. Location: Relais 6 is located in a quiet residential area. It's the nicest building along the whole street. There's a pizzeria 5 minutes away by foot (which gets packed during weekends) and there're bus stops a couple of minutes away. It took about 20 minutes to get to Termini station by bus. Overall, Relais 6 offered us great value and I would recommend it to fellow travelers, though I'm also keen to keep it as one of Rome's "hidden gems".

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: trinamblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Relias 6 for four nights and enjoyed every moment . The quality is fantastic, the staff are Profesional Helpful but above all freindly . The breakfast was great with plenty of food and choice. There are no negatives ,well only one which seems a bit churlish -The booking included a free mini bar for the first night .having had a long day traveling we could have done with a tipple of something but alas it was all soft drinks . Although not the best location there are regular buses around the corner and it was quite .All in all one of the best hotels we've stayed in . I seriuosly recommend relias 6

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, comfort and location...will return”
Reviews.Author: Chris901
Reviews.Content: Trip to Rome with wife and two teenage children, and I found that few hotels have family rooms and that reasonable quality accommodation in the centre of Rome is very expensive. Took a "chance" on Relais 6 as one or two Tripadviser reviewers said it is a bit far out (it is definitely not walking distance) but I could not have been more delighted. We got adjoining rooms for less than the cost of one inferior standard hotel room in the centre of Rome. Spacious rooms, Comfortable beds, spotlessly clean, free wi-fi, charming sitting room, lovely furniture, very nice continental breakfast (with cooked eggs on request at no charge) pleasant staff, super-quiet area. Indeed, if you want to come back/forth during the day it is a bit out of the way but we went out after breakfast and stayed out all day and then ate locally to the hotel at night (cheaper, better food than in Rome centre). Taxi into Rome only 10-12 Euros/10 minutes and you can buy unlimited bus/metro tickets for 11 Euros for 3 days and a bus goes by the top of the street.... Staff were friendly and recommended a wonderful steak restaurant a 5 minute cab ride away- which was full of locals and not "touristy". Thoroughly excellent value for money and lives up to its four-star badge.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent service”
Reviews.Author: Johanna62
Reviews.Content: Great friendly and helpful staff. We booked a superior room for 3 nights, which was larger and with a huge private balcony. The hotel was beautiful furnished, with a lot of antique and very clean. Located in a quiet area but a little far from the metro station. The bus stop is just around the corner so this was a good alternative to get to the city centre. You can buy the tickets for the bus and metro at the reception. We haven't found a good restaurant in the neighbourhood, i would advise to take the bus to the city centre, there were plenty of pizzeria's with better prices and quality.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Rome - Its true, its a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belmont_NJ
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome, Like many of you, I searched high and low for a decent hotel. I came across this hotel and the reviews were just fantastic....maybe too good to be true, but Its true, it is a wonderful hotel. The staff are amazing and more than helpful. We booked direct with them and the cost was very reasonable especially for a four star hotel. They also have offers on site. The bedroom was spacious and the bed was the most comfortable I have slept on in a hotel. The area around the hotel is lovely and the staff will even reserve a table at a local restaurant (San Marino) for you. The food is lovely and reasonable because locals visit it regularly. There was always a queue waiting for tables. Getting around is easy, and it really is not too far from the heart of Rome. Just 10 minutes on the bus. You can obtain a day ticket for the bus and metro from the hotel for 4 Euros. They provide a map and information on tours. I emailed the hotel after booking and they arranged a car to transfer us from the airport to the hotel for around 50 Euros. It was worth it. Especially as it was our first time to Rome. Breakfast was plentiful. They have a huge choice and it really did get us started for the long days of sight seeing. I was excited about this hotel after reading the reviews and the quick response the hotel gave when emailing them before the trip. They exceeded my expectations and I will be returning again! -Travelling and sightseeing around Rome I would advise jumping on google to get a map of the metro system of Rome. It is very easy, just two lines, but it will prepare you to know where to jump off to get to the sights. Entry to the sights is very reasonable, many are free and some of the guided tours can be way over the odds, especially if a sight is free entry anyway. I would advise purchasing a Roma Pass for 25 euros at one of the tourist offices at termini station. It gives you free travel on the bus and metro for three days. It also gives you free entry into the first two sites you visit. Then you get a discount towards additional sites. One thing to point out, the Roma Pass is not valid at the Vatican. Vatican City is an independent city. Entry to the Vatican is 15 euros, but it is well worth it. It will take a couple of hours to see it all! I would like to say a big thank you to Relais 6. I had a wonderful stay and it was a perfect introduction to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Be Right Back”
Reviews.Author: paulg86
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and it was a learning experience in many ways. If you are planning on taking a taxi to the hotel then pre-book it before you arrive and this will save you 20 euros. The hotel is amazing and arriving by night really set the scene of a beautiful, peaceful hotel; perfect for couples and those looking for a cheeky weekend. As others have mentioned the front desk staff are very helpful, polite and nothing is too much trouble. However the true stars of the hotel are the waiters and waitresses who really go that extra mile to accommodate you during meal times. The rooms are very spacious, beds comfortable and the bathrooms extremely relaxing. This is a truly stylish hotel which effortlessly combines modern touches with classical elements. The food was nice although a little basic at breakfast time; but with some great restaurants just a few minutes walk away then you can't really go wrong. Another little note is that it's about 50% cheaper to eat by the hotel than it is in the city. All in all this was an amazing hotel and my fiancée was truly impressed with it. We will be going back as soon as time permits. Getting into the city is an easy forty minutes walk but walking there and then around the sights can really take it out of your legs (and this is coming from a fit and healthy pair of 20-somethings). The walk to the metro only takes about 10 minutes and for 4 euros you can ride the metro all day (just watch out for pick pockets).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keddy1976
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay in the Relais 6. It is a very charming hotel with a little garden and backyard (and a very cute little cat! :-) ). Around are other villas with nice gardens and not far away you find some nice shops and restaurants which are not full of tourists. The rooms are big and very nice furnished. We had two balconys and the bed was excellent. We never slept so good in a hotel before. I wanted to take the bed with me... :-) The service was nice and we got a lot of information at the frontdesk. We walked every day to the citycenter and that took around 20 minutes...but that was no problem. If you don`t like to walk you can go by bus to/from the citycenter and that cost 1 Euro!!! per person and takes around 10 minutes. Next time i Rome = RELAIS &!!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: celestekb
Reviews.Content: we stayed here after our original hotel had overbooked, and re-booked us here. The hotel is professional, clean, comfortable and high quality. our room was lovely, quiet and had a great tub. the breakfast is great, we also took part in the happy hour dinner and drinks - there is a little patio out back that was quiet and very charming. Fabrizio at the front desk was very helpful as well as pretty funny. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend. Also ... since this place isn't in the middle of the city, the shops and the restaurants near by are targeted more to locals and tourists, which was a nice change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Rooms, Easy access to the City”
Reviews.Author: recklessunion
Reviews.Content: We had a really great stay at this hotel. It's a little outside the city (about 2-3km from the center), but it's definitely worth it. You can get into town easily with multiple buses right around the corner and you have access to every part of the city. Our room was modern, good size, clean, had great A/C, and was VERY quiet. Breakfast was good. The whole hotel seems very unique, classy, comfortable, and somewhat homey. There is a pretty nice rooftop for some romantic night-caps. We got a really good deal on the rooms, so it was a great value as well. We would definitely stay here again next time, and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “thank you relais 6”
Reviews.Author: waleedalissar
Reviews.Content: we stayed 6 nights. the hotel was neat, excellent room service and staff... away 5 min walk from bus stop, then 15-20 min from termini station. i'd like to point out that they kept our luggage - free of charge - while we visited venice for 2 days... that was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Slight Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: EuropeExplorer18
Reviews.Content: We checked in this hotel by chance for one night as the original one that I booked (for four nights) was overbooked. We were assured by the original one that they will definitely have a room for us on the next day. This hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, looks well maintained. As it is not close to Metro, bus and tram stops are located at the main road. The gentleman who checked us in was well mannered and helpful with maps and direction to nearest bus stops. When we checked out on the next morning, the gentleman at the front desk was rude. He wave with his back of his hand toward us, the hand gesture seems to tell us 'off you go, you are not really a guest of our hotel'. When I requested him to call a cab for us to transfer back to the original hotel that I booked, he just cut short my conversation and said 'I know' without letting me finish the sentence. Apparently there must be a remark or instruction on the computer screen that inform the front desk staff to follow up while the guest checking out. To be fair, this is only an individual attitude towards his job, this would not affect my decision to stay here again if the price is right and it suits my needs.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and price!”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleMrsC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in May and I was a bit nervous about the location after hearing the reviews however I am so glad this didn't put me off. There is a bus stop 2 minutes from the hotel and this bus goes past about every 10 minutes and it takes you to the Termini (main Metro/train station) in Rome, this trip took 15minutes at the most. Yes some of the buses are very full but if thats the case wait for the next one! From the Termini you can get to most of the sites and if you are mobile you can walk between them. I was glad to use the public transport because it made me feel less of a tourist! The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, the staff are friendly and helpful - they gave us a map when we first arrived and explained where everything was. I definately recommend having a nice strong coffee with breakfast, it really sets you up for the day! If I was to return to Rome (and I hope I do - I LOVED IT!) I would stay at this hotel. One more tip book your tickets for the Vatican online - the queue if you turn up on the day is about 3hrs long!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel on our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: PLCSE
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind, or enjoy being just a bit out of the city center, this is a fantastic hotel. You will need to take the bus for about 10 minutes to get to the sites. However, the quality of the hotel and price makes it worth the effort. Our room, on the 4th floor, was large, clean and had a great view of the quiet, upscale neighborhood. The staff was friendly. My two daughters, 16 and 12 slept on the pull-out sofa, which was comfortable. There are a few restaurants within walking distance that are good.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: atworthWiltshire
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was lovely ....the personal touch was fantastic ...It was my husbands 50 Birthday and we wanted to relax and sight see...The reception staff were wonderful and helpful....The hotel is 10 mins outside of Rome but buses excellent ..We found a marvellous Restaurant/Pizzeria called Peppe Verde 10 mins from hotel...we would stay again and definitely reccomend Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Truly beautiful hotel - Shame about the location..”
Reviews.Author: Hevrhi
Reviews.Content: It's so disappointing because I want to rave about this hotel, it is as good as the earlier reviews say, but we only stayed in Rome for two days and it just wasn't close enough to be able to see everything without feeling exhausted from walking! There are buses from the end of the road, but when we looked at a few that passed us people were just packed in like sardines in a can! So we ended up walking to Bologna Metro station which is a 15/20 min walk.. It doesn't sound like much, but when you're wandering around Rome for a whole day, it would be really nice to jump off the Metro on your way back home and be straight back at the hotel instead of having to walk for another 20 mins.. The hotel itself is just lovely, and almost makes it worth the location. If you're not so bothered about the walk, then my review of the hotel is that it's a real haven after being in the very busy centre of Rome all day, and it's so nice to come back to a pretty, quiet, residential area, to a classy hotel. The rooms were very tall, modern and clean, and the shower was fantastic! Breakfast was served between 7-10am, it was continental, hams, cheeses croissants, cereal, toast etc. Staff were so so helpful, I can't fault any of them, when we needed help finding our way into the centre we were given all sorts of maps and different options.. Somebody has written in an earlier review, if you are staying for a couple of days this isn't the hotel for you, I agree. But if you have more time to take in the sights of Rome and you won't be rushing around, then I can't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “So pretty! Close enough to everything, but only for active people.”
Reviews.Author: upsandowns
Reviews.Content: We rented one apartment (two rooms with kitchenette) and one double for our family of six over the Christmas holiday, and could not have been more pleased. The hotel is newly opened, clean, pretty, with good service and a good breakfast. (The coffee could have been better, but everything else was just great.) The rooms are spacious for Rome, an excellent value, and have truly terrific showers. Safes in the room worked well, light blocking shades for naps, mostly quiet at night. The front desk staff was good. Even when we overheard other tourists being truly obnoxious, we only heard gracious replies from the staff. They helped us solve a few problems, made phone calls for us, printed maps, etc. Most of them were friendly, all were at least polite. No one seems to answer emails, however. Free internet access, and a computer on the first floor for those who don't bring one. IT IS about a 4 kilometer walk from the center of Rome, or 8 minutes by convenient bus. We generally took the bus into the city center and walked home at night (to walk off some of that terrific Italian food, about 20- 30 minutes, depending on where we began). The walk was nice, and not a problem for us at all, but the location might be a little far out for some people. The buses were quick, frequent, & never too crowded. We had Roma Pass. Our only real disappointment was the lack of cooking classes. They advertised that they offered classes and tastings, but we were told that this was still in the planning stages. This was a disappointment, as it was part of the reason that we chose the hotel, but by the end of our stay, we were glad to have been there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Newer Hotel but Not Recommended for Sight-Seeing and Guests on Holiday”
Reviews.Author: valid908
Reviews.Content: I have to explain my rating because in some ways this was a good hotel but the overall impression and experience for me personally was poor (so thus my rating). I will give a bit of history to explain my rating: I arrived from a long flight from overseas to visit Rome for pleasure and to see the historical sights. I was going to rent an apt in the Ghetto district with some friends but then decided to stay at this hotel because of the excellent reviews and felt it was better to stay on my own. I didn't realize how far this hotel was from the center of the city and that is my biggest regret in staying here because it was completely inconvenient to the sights and I had to take countless buses and subways to get around and constantly got lost and got packed into sardine cans with people in the buses. Because of this, I couldn't find my friend's most days and since we had no cell phones working it was next to impossible to meet up with them and I only spent 2 days out of the week in rome with them. The hotel staff on the whole is very friendly and helpful and I commend most of their assistance! However, there was a gentlemen that checked me in the 1st day who was very arrogant and rude. He suggested that i take a shower before I ask any further questions about transportation and obviously I smelled bad to him. It could have been so since I had been traveling all day but he shouldn't have asked me to do that and been so rude. The other desk attendants were completely sweet and helpful but he was not and came across consistently snobby and "above" me anytime he was working the desk. As for the room, it was decorated nicely but small and the bathroom was probably the best part since it had a shower and a bathtub and was big (for Europe). The room was fairly clean but my night-stands were consistently dusty so i think that the maid service doesn't dust at all. There was a mini-bar but it only contained a couple of bottled waters and soda (no alcohol). The location of this hotel is the worst part because it's not close to the center of Rome and you have to take the buses to the Termini and then take the subway which can be a real bother! Especially when the buses take forever to come and you have to be squished next to tons of peeps and so it's not good for the claustrophobic (like me)! Steer clear from this hotel just on the basis of location unless you are in Rome for business and have your own car or transportation. On a positive note: The daily breakfast buffet is very nice and the cooks (chefs) very friendly and helpful. There was one young guy in particular that was completely sweet and always wanted to help. Another lady that was his sub that I had during the weekend was very snobby though since I didn't speak Italian. There is also Internet access downstairs on one computer which is free of charge and is nice for people that didn't bring their laptop or hardware with them. There are also blinds in the room that you can scroll up and down which is nice if you want to make the room completely dark or have natural light. Word of caution: There is consistent construction noise in the building next door during the day so if you want a mid-day nap - you might have trouble falling and staying asleep. Also this hotel caters from what I saw to mainly local italians that are here for business and there was a lady that worked for the hotel that as I walked by laughed and said "turista" (hee hee) to a group of Italians that she was assisting and I was extremely offended by her remark and the fact that she was making fun of me being one of the few tourists of the hotel. She did it right in front of my face too and I just mimicked her laugh and made fun of her back (to her face) ridiculous! (considering the "TURISTAS" are her bread and butter). So overall I have to not recommend this hotel even though I did really appreciate some of the nice desk and kitchen staff here. I especially enjoyed this older desk attendant who was completely charming and had a very funny sense of humor which i greatly appreciated being pretty much by myself in a foreign country and not knowing the language. So the bottom line: If you are a "turista" wanting to get in to Rome to enjoy the nightlife and see as much as you can then please find a hotel closer and more user-friendly with foreign tourists!

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: rosmarLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais 6 for 5 nights and we had the most amazing experience. The hotel has been competely refurbished and only opened a few months ago. It is small boutique hotel, with a lot of character, and colonial style charm. The room was very spacious, very clean, super confortable bed and good modern bathroom, plus a little balcony, large ceiling to floor window. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but there were some great local places nearby. Breakfast was good, served in a nice room with views to the back garden. The lounge of the hotel, was beautiful. Tastefully decorated. The hotel is located 10 -15 min bus ride from the city centre. Buses are frequent and stop near the hotel. Night buses also serve this area, and we found it very easy to use the network - also nice to go back to a quiet area after spending the day in busy Rome. The service was outstanding. All the staff were very helpful and friendly, but not intrusive. The guy serving the breakfast during the weekdays was very attentive, made great coffee, and ran the place so smothly you would not even notice he was there but everythig was set up to perfection. We had an amazing time, and will definetely come back to Relais 6 when we decide to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel outside the tourist district”
Reviews.Author: cruiser25
Reviews.Content: This recently refurbished building is beautifully and expensively done in many colors of marble, different woods, and different metals. It is a visual delight. The hotel is located in a high rent residental neighborhood that also contains several embassies. If you go to the restaurants within easy walking distance you may be the only tourist there. For us this turned out to be a great plus as unfortunately, some of the restaurants in the tourist areas view cheating tourists as a sport. Our favorite local restaurant is San Marino Pizza which also serves a variety of dishes.(Great thin crust pizza; pasta and bean soup that will ruin your enjoyment of the same served at most American restaurants, and half a liter of wine for 3 euros.) The neighborhood restaurants are in the business of seeking repeat business from customers and treat all their customers very well. If you only have a couple of days in Rome and want to try and see all the historical sights and want or need to go to your hotel in between sights, this is not the hotel for you. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Bologna subway station on the Blue Line. Most of the historical sights are either on the Blue Line or require transfer to the Red Line at Termini where the two lines cross. There is a bus 3 blocks away that will take you to either the Bologna station or Termini. For the Bologna station take either the 310 or 93 if you don't want to walk. The subway trains run every couple of minutes. The only drawback is that sometimes you pack in pretty tight, ditto for the busses. Rome is appallingly covered with graffitti; the graffitti in the neighboorhood of the hotel does not indicate a lack of safety,but on first arrrival it is disconcerting. Ditto for the security shutters on the hotel's windows. You see them all over Rome and they make for a great black out if you arrive tired and want to sleep in late. We stayed seven nights and sought advice about the city from several desk clerks. All but one were unfailing polite. One, when asked what bus to take to the subway replied, "I am not God; I do not know everything." However, on other occasions this clerk was gracious. Overall, I would rate the service excellent. If you arrive at FCO you can take a cab to the hotel. The average price is supposed to be 50 euros, but we paid 58. Or you can take an express train (11 or 12 euros per person) to Termini and then either take a cab (about 10 euros) or just take the subway to Bologna station and then walk. (It helps is you arm yourself with a Google map beforehand). Returning to the airport, you have the hotel arrange a private car (50 Euros) or use public transportation. We chose the private car and were very pleased. If you don't want to do public transportation to get to the hotel I would recommend calling them and asking them to have a car for you. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel, found the staff friendly and helpful, and after the first couple of days were delighted to be outside the tourist area in an upscale neighborhood. If you don't mind being crowded on the subway, the subway is fast and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Where also can you find in Rome, where the vast majority of the hotels seem to be hugely overpriced, a brand new hotel, situated in a quiet area, with comfortable and well appointed rooms, for just 80 euros/night? By the way, wifi is free and so are national phone calls. An excellent find, fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Willow2008Uk
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in a good neighbourhood. Easily connected to the city centre on one direct and quick bus. The room was really nice and had a really good size balcony which was unexpected. It was very clean, tastefully decorated and comfortable. The staff were so friendly and helpful and always made us smile. They were able to recommend nearby restaurants, although we chose to eat in the centre most nights and since the buses run so late there was never a problem getting back to the hotel. Overall this is a brilliant hotel and I would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “A very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: atirairam
Reviews.Content: I have passed here one of the best week in my life! It is a wonderful hotel, in a central position, very well connected with the main interest places of the city. The personnel is very kind and available to support you. The rooms are very spacious and full of comfortable facilities. I have loved the tasteful interior design. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Bello Bello Bello!”
Reviews.Author: angIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais 6 during a recent weekend visit to The Eternal City. It was a real 'find', a newly opened, beautiful hotel situated in a quiet, exclusive area near the city centre and all main sights. The hotel is impeccable; lovely, comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast, friendly, professional staff. It really made our stay in Rome extra-special and I would highly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Relais 6
HotelInfo.Address: Via Tolmino 6, 00198 Rome, Italy
